TEXT.English: Ratha can only be built with Empyrean as your state religion and present in a city, but do not require the siege workshop like a regular chariot. They can cast the Blinding Light spell to hold enemies in place, and are secondary class Disciples - they can use any bonuses to disciple units, such as the Spiritual trait. They also have 3 perception which allows them to spot any of your rival's assassins, and they are more effective against rogue class units, making them a helpful counter against those fond of assassins and thieves. Be aware, they do not have enough perception to spot a hostile Shadow without further promotions like Sentry.
TEXT.French: Ratha can only be built with Empyrean as your state religion and present in a city, but do not require the siege workshop like a regular chariot. They can cast the Blinding Light spell to hold enemies in place, and are secondary class Disciples - they can use any bonuses to disciple units, such as the Spiritual trait. They also have 3 perception which allows them to spot any of your rival's assassins, and they are more effective against rogue class units, making them a helpful counter against those fond of assassins and thieves. Be aware, they do not have enough perception to spot a hostile Shadow without further promotions like Sentry.

TEXT.English: Chariots require more technology than Horsemen - both Trade and Construction as well as a siege workshop, and lack Flank Attack and anti-archer bonuses, but in exchange they have higher offensive strength and the ability to use weapons. You can use them as a more powerful alternative to Horsemen before you move on to higher tech units like Champions and Horse Archers.
TEXT.French: Chariots require more technology than Horsemen - both Trade and Construction as well as a siege workshop, and lack Flank Attack and anti-archer bonuses, but in exchange they have higher offensive strength and the ability to use weapons. You can use them as a more powerful alternative to Horsemen before you move on to higher tech units like Champions and Horse Archers.
TEXT.German: Chariots require more technology than Horsemen - both Trade and Construction as well as a siege workshop, and lack Flank Attack and anti-archer bonuses, but in exchange they have higher offensive strength and the ability to use weapons. You can use them as a more powerful alternative to Horsemen before you move on to higher tech units like Champions and Horse Archers.
TEXT.Italian: Chariots require more technology than Horsemen - both Trade and Construction as well as a siege workshop, and lack Flank Attack and anti-archer bonuses, but in exchange they have higher offensive strength and the ability to use weapons. You can use them as a more powerful alternative to Horsemen before you move on to higher tech units like Champions and Horse Archers.
TEXT.Spanish: Chariots require more technology than Horsemen - both Trade and Construction as well as a siege workshop, and lack Flank Attack and anti-archer bonuses, but in exchange they have higher offensive strength and the ability to use weapons. You can use them as a more powerful alternative to Horsemen before you move on to higher tech units like Champions and Horse Archers.

TEXT.English: With high movement, a first strike, and withdrawal chance, the horseman can serve as a mobile response to threats across your territory, or use their bonus against archers to soften up hostile cities. Most units of the horseman line have Flank Attack against siege weapons, which lets them deal collateral damage to siege units when they win a battle or withdraw against a hostile stack that includes siege.
TEXT.French: With high movement, a first strike, and withdrawal chance, the horseman can serve as a mobile response to threats across your territory, or use their bonus against archers to soften up hostile cities. Most units of the horseman line have Flank Attack against siege weapons, which lets them deal collateral damage to siege units when they win a battle or withdraw against a hostile stack that includes siege.
TEXT.German: With high movement, a first strike, and withdrawal chance, the horseman can serve as a mobile response to threats across your territory, or use their bonus against archers to soften up hostile cities. Most units of the horseman line have Flank Attack against siege weapons, which lets them deal collateral damage to siege units when they win a battle or withdraw against a hostile stack that includes siege.
TEXT.Italian: With high movement, a first strike, and withdrawal chance, the horseman can serve as a mobile response to threats across your territory, or use their bonus against archers to soften up hostile cities. Most units of the horseman line have Flank Attack against siege weapons, which lets them deal collateral damage to siege units when they win a battle or withdraw against a hostile stack that includes siege.
TEXT.Spanish: With high movement, a first strike, and withdrawal chance, the horseman can serve as a mobile response to threats across your territory, or use their bonus against archers to soften up hostile cities. Most units of the horseman line have Flank Attack against siege weapons, which lets them deal collateral damage to siege units when they win a battle or withdraw against a hostile stack that includes siege.

TEXT.English: Horse Archers have higher strength and withdraw chance than the Horseman and can have their strength increased with several resources. They can use bronze or iron weapons with the appropriate technology and can also ride nightmares or hyapon for even more strength. Additionally, they have defensive strikes and weak ranged attacks they can use to soften up targets.
TEXT.French: Horse Archers have higher strength and withdraw chance than the Horseman and can have their strength increased with several resources. They can use bronze or iron weapons with the appropriate technology and can also ride nightmares or hyapon for even more strength. Additionally, they have defensive strikes and weak ranged attacks they can use to soften up targets.

They can use bronze or iron weapons with the appropriate technology and can also ride nightmares or hyapon for even more strength. Additionally, they have defensive strikes and weak ranged attacks they can use to soften up targets.

Additionally, they have defensive strikes and weak ranged attacks they can use to soften up targets.

TEXT.English: While knights no longer have the weak ranged attacks or defensive strikes of horse archers, they serve as powerful and versatile national units. Increase their strength further with weapons technology or alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: While knights no longer have the weak ranged attacks or defensive strikes of horse archers, they serve as powerful and versatile national units. Increase their strength further with weapons technology or alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.German: While knights no longer have the weak ranged attacks or defensive strikes of horse archers, they serve as powerful and versatile national units. Increase their strength further with weapons technology or alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.Italian: While knights no longer have the weak ranged attacks or defensive strikes of horse archers, they serve as powerful and versatile national units. Increase their strength further with weapons technology or alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.Spanish: While knights no longer have the weak ranged attacks or defensive strikes of horse archers, they serve as powerful and versatile national units. Increase their strength further with weapons technology or alternate mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: War Chariots are the final unit of mounted technology. Much like Chariots, they do not have a bonus against Archer units or Flank Attack, but have higher strength than Knights. A War Chariot has the same strength as an Immortal, and can become even stronger with weapons technology and access to alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: War Chariots are the final unit of mounted technology. Much like Chariots, they do not have a bonus against Archer units or Flank Attack, but have higher strength than Knights. A War Chariot has the same strength as an Immortal, and can become even stronger with weapons technology and access to alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.German: War Chariots are the final unit of mounted technology. Much like Chariots, they do not have a bonus against Archer units or Flank Attack, but have higher strength than Knights. A War Chariot has the same strength as an Immortal, and can become even stronger with weapons technology and access to alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.Italian: War Chariots are the final unit of mounted technology. Much like Chariots, they do not have a bonus against Archer units or Flank Attack, but have higher strength than Knights. A War Chariot has the same strength as an Immortal, and can become even stronger with weapons technology and access to alternate mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.Spanish: War Chariots are the final unit of mounted technology. Much like Chariots, they do not have a bonus against Archer units or Flank Attack, but have higher strength than Knights. A War Chariot has the same strength as an Immortal, and can become even stronger with weapons technology and access to alternate mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: War Elephants cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed elephants. Unlike tamed elephants, they are allowed to attack and don't have the penalty against cities that most tamed beasts do. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other mounted units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion.
TEXT.French: War Elephants cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed elephants. Unlike tamed elephants, they are allowed to attack and don't have the penalty against cities that most tamed beasts do. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other mounted units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion.
TEXT.German: War Elephants cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed elephants. Unlike tamed elephants, they are allowed to attack and don't have the penalty against cities that most tamed beasts do. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other mounted units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion.
TEXT.Italian: War Elephants cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed elephants. Unlike tamed elephants, they are allowed to attack and don't have the penalty against cities that most tamed beasts do. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other mounted units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion.
TEXT.Spanish: War Elephants cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed elephants. Unlike tamed elephants, they are allowed to attack and don't have the penalty against cities that most tamed beasts do. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other moutned units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion.

TEXT.English: Mammoth Riders cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed mamoths. Unlike tamed mammoths, they are allowed to attack and don't have the penalty against cities that most tamed beasts do. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other mounted units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion. Compared to elephants, mammoths have 1 higher strength and the winterborn promotion, increasing their strength in cold environments.
TEXT.French: Mammoth Riders cannot be built - they can only be upgraded from tamed mamoths. They only have 2 movement, unlike most other mounted units, but are strong against other mounted units, have high base strength and gain experience faster with their Elephant Blood promotion. Compared to elephants, mammoths have 1 higher strength and the winterborn promotion, increasing their strength in cold environments.

TEXT.English: Nyxkin don't require horses, instead starting with Tiger Mounts, granting them Stealth 1 and an extra first strike. They are otherwise the same as the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: Nyxkin don't require horses, instead starting with Tiger Mounts, granting them Stealth 1 and an extra first strike. They are otherwise the same as the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: The Ostuarii Rider does not require resources, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. It has +1 death strength, but is otherwise identical to the Horseman it replaces.
TEXT.French: The Ostuarii Rider does not require resources, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. It has +1 death strength, but is otherwise identical to the Horseman it replaces.

TEXT.English: The Ostuarii Knight does not require resources, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. It has +2 death strength, but is otherwise identical to the Knight it replaces.
TEXT.French: The Ostuarii Knight does not require resources, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. It has +2 death strength, but is otherwise identical to the Knight it replaces.

TEXT.English: Similar to other Mekaran Militia units, the Mounted Militia requires the Magistrate's Office rather than a stables, and is slightly weaker - with 1 less defensive strength than a Horseman.
TEXT.French: Similar to other Mekaran Militia units, the Mounted Militia requires the Magistrate's Office rather than a stables, and is slightly weaker - with 1 less defensive strength than a Horseman.

TEXT.English: Skirmishers are only available to the Mekara under Iram Damarr. Much like other Militia, they require the Magistrate's Office. They have 1 less offensive strength, but stronger ranged attacks than a regular Horse Archer.
TEXT.French: Skirmishers are only available to the Mekara under Iram Damarr. Much like other Militia, they require the Magistrate's Office. They have 1 less offensive strength, but stronger ranged attacks than a regular Horse Archer.

TEXT.English: MountedTweaksMod note - originally Dragoons were the only horse archer that could use weapons. Since I've shared the love and other horse archers can now use weapons, all Dragoons have over horse archers now is style. I may in future find a small buff to give them in exchange, but for now, they are functionally identical to horse archers.
TEXT.French: MountedTweaksMod note - originally Dragoons were the only horse archer that could use weapons. Since I've shared the love and other horse archers can now use weapons, all Dragoons have over horse archers now is style. I may in future find a small buff to give them in exchange, but for now, they are functionally identical to horse archers.

Since I've shared the love and other horse archers can now use weapons, all Dragoons have over horse archers now is style. I may in future find a small buff to give them in exchange, but for now, they are functionally identical to horse archers.

TEXT.English: The Malakim Raider is identical to the horseman it replaces, but can be built with camels and can gain the camel mount promotion, further increasing their effectiveness in deserts.
TEXT.French: The Malakim Raider is identical to the horseman it replaces, but can be built with camels and can gain the camel mount promotion, further increasing their effectiveness in deserts.

TEXT.English: The Malakim Camel Archer is identical to the horse archer it replaces, but can be built with camels and can gain the camel mount promotion, further increasing their effectiveness in deserts.

TEXT.English: The Malakim Camel Knight is identical to the knight it replaces, but can be built with camels and can gain the camel mount promotion, further increasing their effectiveness in deserts.

TEXT.English: Fyrdwell don't require horses, instead starting with Stag Mounts, granting them improved forest movement and magic resistance. They have stronger ranged attacks than the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: Fyrdwell don't require horses, instead starting with Stag Mounts, granting them improved forest movement and magic resistance. They have stronger ranged attacks than the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: The War Tortoise only has 1 speed and lower attack strength, but very high defensive strength, water walking, and a large bonus vs mounted units. Be wary, though, as it still cannot receieve defensive bonuses and cannot use special mounts.
TEXT.French: The War Tortoise only has 1 speed and lower attack strength, but very high defensive strength, water walking, and a large bonus vs mounted units. Be wary, though, as it still cannot receieve defensive bonuses and cannot use special mounts.

TEXT.English: Much like a regular Centuar, a Centuar Charger replaces the Chariot but does not require the siege workshop. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.
TEXT.French: Much like a regular Centuar, a Centuar Charger replaces the Chariot but does not require the siege workshop. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.

TEXT.Spanish: Much like a regular Centuar, a Centuar Charger replaces the Chariot but does not require the siege workshop. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.

TEXT.English: Centaurs require no resource or building, and gain defensive bonuses from terrain or cities, unlike other civs' mounted units. So in addition to the Horseman's role of softening up strong foes with withdrawal or pillaging, they can function as mobile defenders for distant settlements. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.
TEXT.French: Centaurs require no resource or building, and gain defensive bonuses from terrain or cities, unlike other civs' mounted units. So in addition to the Horseman's role of softening up strong foes with withdrawal or pillaging, they can function as mobile defenders for distant settlements. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.
TEXT.German: Centaurs require no resource or building, and gain defensive bonuses from terrain or cities, unlike other civs' mounted units. So in addition to the Horseman's role of softening up strong foes with withdrawal or pillaging, they can function as mobile defenders for distant settlements. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.
TEXT.Italian: Centaurs require no resource or building, and gain defensive bonuses from terrain or cities, unlike other civs' mounted units. So in addition to the Horseman's role of softening up strong foes with withdrawal or pillaging, they can function as mobile defenders for distant settlements. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.
TEXT.Spanish: Centaurs require no resource or building, and gain defensive bonuses from terrain or cities, unlike other civs' mounted units. So in addition to the Horseman's role of softening up strong foes with withdrawal or pillaging, they can function as mobile defenders for distant settlements. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon.

TEXT.English: Centaur Archers do not require a resource or building and are 1 strength higher than the Horse Archer they replace. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.
TEXT.French: Centaur Archers do not require a resource or building and are 1 strength higher than the Horse Archer they replace. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.
TEXT.German: Centaur Archers do not require a resource or building and are 1 strength higher than the Horse Archer they replace. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.

All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.
TEXT.Spanish: Centaur Archers do not require a resource or building and are 1 strength higher than the Horse Archer they replace. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.

TEXT.English: Centaur Lancers do not require a resource (but do require the Hippodrome building) and are 1 strength higher than the Knight they replace. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.
TEXT.French: Centaur Lancers do not require a resource (but do require the Hippodrome building) and are 1 strength higher than the Knight they replace. All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.

All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.

All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.

All Centuars can receive defensive bonuses from their tile and can Sprint, but they cannot use alternate mounts and the bonuses they entail like nightmares and hyapon - though this is offset by their higher base strength.

TEXT.English: The Bear Rider may be a Horse Archer replacement, but does not have any ranged attacks or defensive strikes and does not require Archery or any resources. As it starts with Great Beast Mounts, it has 2 strength higher than the Horse Archer it replaces, but -1 movement but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon. It can serve as a powerhouse offensive unit, especially with bronze or iron weapons.

As it starts with Great Beast Mounts, it has 2 strength higher than the Horse Archer it replaces, but -1 movement but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon. It can serve as a powerhouse offensive unit, especially with bronze or iron weapons.

TEXT.English: A dwarven Hornguard starts with Great Beast Mounts - it has 2 more strength than the knight it replaces, but 1 less movement. They do not require horses to be built, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: A dwarven Hornguard starts with Great Beast Mounts - it has 2 more strength than the knight it replaces, but 1 less movement. They do not require horses to be built, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: A dwarven Boar Rider starts with Boar Mounts, giving it speed 2 and 40% bonus versus melee instead of a 40% bonus versus archers. They will make short work of any un-upgraded warriors, as well as other early melee units like Skeletons from Agares. They require pigs, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: A dwarven Boar Rider starts with Boar Mounts, giving it speed 2 and 40% bonus versus melee instead of a 40% bonus versus archers. They will make short work of any un-upgraded warriors, as well as other early melee units like Skeletons from Agares. They require pigs, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

They require pigs, and can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: Fyrdwell don't require horses, instead starting with Stag Mounts, granting them improved forest movement and magic resistance. They have stronger ranged attacks than the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. They are also Secondary Archers, allowing them to gain benefits for archer class units, like the Flaming Arrows spell.
TEXT.French: Fyrdwell don't require horses, instead starting with Stag Mounts, granting them improved forest movement and magic resistance. They have stronger ranged attacks than the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. They are also Secondary Archers, allowing them to gain benefits for archer class units, like the Flaming Arrows spell.

They have stronger ranged attacks than the horse archers they replace, but can only use tamed animal mounts, not horses mounts like hyapon. They are also Secondary Archers, allowing them to gain benefits for archer class units, like the Flaming Arrows spell.

TEXT.English: Fyrdwell Champions serve as an upgrade to Fyrdwell instead of Knights, functioning effectively as a Ljosalfar replacement for War Chariots - compared to Fyrdwell, they have even more offensive strength, better ranged attacks, and very high withdrawal chance, but no flank attack or archer bonus. They are also still Secondary Archers, allowing them to gain benefits for archer class units, like the Flaming Arrows spell.
TEXT.French: Fyrdwell Champions serve as an upgrade to Fyrdwell instead of Knights, functioning effectively as a Ljosalfar replacement for War Chariots - compared to Fyrdwell, they have even more offensive strength, better ranged attacks, and very high withdrawal chance. They are also still Secondary Archers, allowing them to gain benefits for archer class units, like the Flaming Arrows spell.

They are also still Secondary Archers, allowing them to gain benefits for archer class units, like the Flaming Arrows spell.

TEXT.English: A Spider Huntress doesn't require horses or a stable, and starts with a spider mount - giving them more strength and less movement than a regular horseman. Their reliance on poison strength leaves them weaker against non-living units like demons and constructs. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: A Spider Huntress doesn't require horses or a stable, and starts with a spider mount - giving them more strength and less movement than a regular horseman. Their reliance on poison strength leaves them weaker against non-living units like demons and constructs. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

Their reliance on poison strength leaves them weaker against non-living units like demons and constructs. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

Their reliance on poison strength leaves them weaker against non-living units like demons and constructs. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

Their reliance on poison strength leaves them weaker against non-living units like demons and constructs. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: A Spider Knightess doesn't have ranged attacks or defensive strikes like most horse archers, and shares the same strengths and weaknesses as the preceding Spider Huntress. Much like other Archosian units, they cannot use metal weapons, but start with high poison strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: A Spider Knightess doesn't have ranged attacks or defensive strikes like most horse archers, and shares the same strengths and weaknesses as the preceding Spider Huntress. Much like other Archosian units, they cannot use metal weapons, but start with high poison strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.German: A Spider Knightess doesn't have ranged attacks or defensive strikes like most horse archers, and shares the same strengths and weaknesses as the preceding Spider Huntress. Much like other Archosian units, they cannot use metal weapons, but start with high poison strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.Italian: A Spider Knightess doesn't have ranged attacks or defensive strikes like most horse archers, and shares the same strengths and weaknesses as the preceding Spider Huntress. Much like other Archosian units, they cannot use metal weapons, but start with high poison strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.Spanish: A Spider Knightess doesn't have ranged attacks or defensive strikes like most horse archers, and shares the same strengths and weaknesses as the preceding Spider Huntress. Much like other Archosian units, they cannot use metal weapons, but start with high poison strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: The War Spider, much like other Archos Mounted units, is slower and stronger than the knight it replaces. Compared to the Spider Knightess, it gains a ranged attack and is allowed to use metal weapons. It has the same weakness against non-living units, but less pronounced thanks to its high base strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.
TEXT.French: The War Spider, much like other Archos Mounted units, is slower and stronger than the knight it replaces. Compared to the Spider Knightess, it gains a ranged attack and is allowed to use metal weapons. It has the same weakness against non-living units, but less pronounced thanks to its high base strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

It has the same weakness against non-living units, but less pronounced thanks to its high base strength. They can only use tamed animal mounts, not horse mounts like hyapon.

TEXT.English: The Ostuarii Riders' ghostly mounts provide them extra withdraw chance and death strength, but they are otherwise identical to the Horseman they replace. They can't horses mounts like hyapon, but you could replace their ghostly mounts with a tamed animal, if you wanted to.
TEXT.French: The Ostuarii Riders' ghostly mounts provide them extra withdraw chance and death strength, but they are otherwise identical to the Horseman they replace. They can't horses mounts like hyapon, but you could replace their ghostly mounts with a tamed animal, if you wanted to.

TEXT.English: The Ostuarii Knight use ghostly mounts to provide them extra withdraw chance and death strength, and they start with the marksman promotion - allowing them to easily remove weak units from enemy armies, especially if you can get them the Blitz promotion. They can't horses mounts like hyapon, but you could replace their ghostly mounts with a tamed animal, if you wanted to.
TEXT.French: The Ostuarii Knight use ghostly mounts to provide them extra withdraw chance and death strength, and they start with the marksman promotion - allowing them to easily remove weak units from enemy armies, especially if you can get them the Blitz promotion. They can't horses mounts like hyapon, but you could replace their ghostly mounts with a tamed animal, if you wanted to.

They can't horses mounts like hyapon, but you could replace their ghostly mounts with a tamed animal, if you wanted to.
